ngiemboon: Tsẅii mbwó Áloŋ, ńtsẅii mbwó penkʉ́ pé pembàŋa, mbɔɔ mbwó pʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ ntsèm ngie:
en: “Speak to Aaron, his sons, and all the Israelites and tell them: This is what the Lord has commanded:

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ mbàŋa na ngẅɛ̀ ndá Ésàlayɛ lɔɔn ńgee ńzẅé fòŋ, é njʉ̀njÿò kà mêmvfó wɔ́ɔ, á tsɛ̀ɛ jʉʼ gie mé tsẅé wó, kà jʉʼ gie mé těen ńtsẅé wó wɔ́ wɔ́,
en: Anyone from the house of Israel who slaughters   an ox, sheep, or goat in the camp, or slaughters it outside the camp,

ngiemboon: mbà à ge vɔg lɔg tóo ncwò ntàb mbumté, é lɔg nuŋe pwɔʼ, á mvfò Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, á na jʉʼʉ ndʉalʉ̌a yé. À lɔɔn ḿbiŋ te gÿo púʼu wɔ́, mbà à ge gwɔ́ ngàŋ mefʉa, ńtí nue à pfɛté metse nɔ̀ɔn gẅie aa ntʉ̀ntʉ̀. À cʉa púʼu, mé fó nùɔ láʼ ńjwoŋo yé.
en: instead of bringing it to the entrance to the tent of meeting to present it as an offering to the Lord before his tabernacle #— #that person will be considered guilty.  ,# 17:4 Ex 22:1; Lv 20:9; Nm 35:27; Dt 19:10; Ps 55:23; Is 33:15 He has shed blood  # 17:4 Gn 9:6 and is to be cut off from his people.  # 17:4 Nm 9:13

ngiemboon: Tá à cʉa púʼu, epʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ le gíŋe ńzẅé menɔ̀ɔn á jʉʼ gie mé téen ńtsẅé wó wɔ́ wɔ́. Pɔ́ lɔg ńtó ńnáa mbwó nùŋepwɔʼ pɔ́ ntʉ̀ntʉ̀ á ncwò ntàb mbumté, à lɔg ńnuŋe pwɔʼ mbʉ́lè á mvfò Cʉ̀apʉ̀a.
en: This is so the Israelites will bring to the Lord the sacrifices   they have been offering in the open country. They are to bring them to the priest at the entrance to the tent of meeting and offer them as fellowship sacrifices  # 17:5 Lv 7:11 to the Lord.

ngiemboon: Anùŋepwɔʼ ge gÿo lɔg metse é zaa jʉʼʉ lenuŋé pwɔʼ gie áa ye Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, á mvfò ncwò ntàb mbumté, é tuɔ mejʉʼ mbab mbòŋo mie é gẅiin mefóon, agyě kwɔ́ʼ, ḿboŋo Cʉ̀apʉ̀a.
en: The priest will then splatter the blood on the Lord’s altar at the entrance to the tent of meeting and burn the fat as a pleasing aroma to the Lord.

ngiemboon: Tá à cʉa púʼu, epʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ le gíŋe ńzẅé menɔ̀ɔn ńnáa mbwó messé mie é gwɔ́ pɔ́ páʼ metútú mefÿɛ̀ wɔ́, sɔɔn é lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ lepʉ̌ sie é ge láʼa gwɔ́ pɔ́ wó, á mbwó pɔ́b, tà mbɔɔ na ngẅɛ̀ yɔb ntsèm na mejwoŋó mejwoŋó.
en: They must no longer offer their sacrifices to the goat-demons   that they have prostituted  # 17:7 Dt 22:21 themselves with. This will be a permanent statute  # 17:7 Gn 26:5; Ex 12:14; Lv 3:17; Nm 9:3; Dt 6:2; 8:11 for them throughout their generations.

ngiemboon: Púʼu, ɔ̀ ge gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Nyìŋ na tsìŋendá Ésàlayɛ, kà pɔ́ na pakÿoláʼ pie pâ pɔ́ tsẅé wɔ́ɔ, lɔɔn ńdáʼ ńgee ńná shúm pwɔʼ sie mé tuɔ tà é pú shÿó pɔ́ ntsèm, kà tsɔ́ mmó pwɔʼ wɔ́ɔ,
en: “Say to them: Anyone from the house of Israel or from the aliens   who reside among them who offers a burnt offering or a sacrifice

ngiemboon: ḿbiŋ te lɔg ńtóo ncwò ntàb mbumté ńnáa mbwó Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wɔ́, mbà mé ge gÿo kẅile yé tsetsɛ̀ɛ pʉ̀a pé.
en: but does not bring it to the entrance to the tent of meeting to sacrifice it to the Lord, that person is to be cut off from his people.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ na ngẅɛ̀ ndá Ésàlayɛ, kà kÿoláʼ wɔ́ɔ, kà gẅie à tsẅé tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b wɔ́ɔ, lɔɔn ḿpfɛ́ metse; kà yɛ̌ ntí metse wɔ́ɔ, mbà mèŋ n ge tém nzèm wɛ̌ nyìŋ gẅie à pfɛ̌ metse, é piŋ fó nùɔ pʉ̀a pé, é kẅile yé.
en: “Anyone from the house of Israel or from the aliens who reside among them who eats any blood,   I will turn  # 17:10 Lit will set my face against that person who eats blood and cut him off from his people.

ngiemboon: Mélàʼmie legwɔ́ we mmó ntsèm gie áa ntʉ̀ntʉ̀, à gwɔ́ pɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ metse. Mèŋ zɔ la ná metse ŋwɛ́ né pi légwɔ́ gie pi ge lɔg tÿó mefʉa mí á jʉʼʉ lenuŋé pwɔʼ. Ńtí nue ée metse mie éfó na legwɔ́ wó, tá mé lɔgɔ ḿvéle mefʉa mí.
en: For the life of a creature is in the blood, and I have appointed it to you to make atonement on the altar for   your lives, since it is the lifeblood that makes atonement.  # 17:11 Mt 26:28; Mk 14:24; Rm 3:25; 5:9; Eph 1:7; Col 1:14,20; Heb 13:12; 1Jn 1:7; Rv 1:5

ngiemboon: Yɔɔn áa mmó gie á gÿǒ mèŋ n gɔ̌ɔn mbwó pʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ ngie: Atsɔ̌ nyìŋ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi těen ńdáʼa ḿpfɛ́ɛ metse wɔ́, atsɔ́ tàʼ na kÿoláʼ gie áa tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi á le pfɛ́.
en: Therefore I say to the Israelites: None of you and no alien who resides among you may eat blood.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ, kà tsetsɛ̀ɛ pakÿoláʼ pie pɔ́ lâ pɔ̌ tsẅé wɔ́ɔ, lɔɔn ńdáʼ ńgʉa pwóon, ńgwoon nɔ̀ɔn gẅie ngwɔ́ mé pfɛ́, kà meshʉ̌ŋ gẅie mé pfɛ́ɛ wɔ́ɔ, mbà à ge pfɛte metse, é lɔgɔ tsetsáʼ, é pwoon.
en: “Any Israelite or alien residing among them, who hunts   down a wild animal or bird that may be eaten must drain its blood  # 17:13 Ex 29:12; Lv 17:4; Dt 12:16,24; 15:23; Ezk 24:7 and cover it with dirt.

ngiemboon: Mélàʼmie legwɔ́ wó we mmó ntsèm gie áa ntʉ̀ntʉ̀, áa tsɛ̀ɛ metse mé, mbà mèŋ n da piŋ ńgɔɔn mbwó pʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ ngie: Pi těen ńdáʼa ḿpfɛ́ɛ metse mbab wɔ́, mélàʼmie legwɔ́ we mmó ntsèm gie áa ntʉ̀ntʉ̀ aa tsɛ̀ɛ metse mé; nyìŋ gẅie à ge piŋ láʼ pfɛ́, mé ge láʼ jwoŋo yé.
en: Since the life of every creature is its blood, I have told the Israelites: You are not to eat the blood of any creature,   because the life of every creature is its blood; whoever eats it must be cut off.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pʉ̀a láʼ kà kÿoláʼ wɔ́ɔ, lɔɔn ḿpfɛ́ɛ nɔ̀ɔn gẅie à kwě kwé kà gẅie nɔ̀ɔn mbàʼ zɔ zẅé wɔ́ɔ, mbà à ge sɔg menzsǒ mé, ésɔg mbùm ye, é cʉ́ʼʉ nyìŋ ncÿǒ tà tyé ncwònzém.
en: “Every person, whether the native or the resident alien,   who eats an animal that died a natural death or was mauled by wild beasts  # 17:15 Ex 22:31; Lv 7:24; 22:8; Dt 14:21 is to wash his clothes and bathe with water, and he will remain unclean until evening; then he will be clean.

ngiemboon: À lɔɔn te sɔg menzsǒ mé wɔ́, ńké te sɔg mbùm ye wɔ́, mbà à ge gÿo kaa mefʉa mé.
en: But if he does not wash his clothes and bathe himself, he will bear his iniquity.”
